intro: Dianthus darvazicus, commonly known as the Darvaz carnation, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant features slender, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat. The flowers are known to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
